articles.title: AI giants' less-is-more logic bears three caveats
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Bosses of big technology firms may find reassurance in comparing artificial intelligence to a lump of coal, as claimed by the company.    in the claim by the technology company, which is called Claimed, that artificial intelligence is more reliable than coal.

articles.title: Report finds that 40% of small business owners are using AI tools for help – WBBJ-TV
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Report finds that 40% of small business owners are using AI tools for help, according to WBBJ-TV. WBBj-TV report finds that AI tools are being used for help by 40%. WBB jv.com reports.

articles.title: Fact Check: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum Did NOT Wear 'Make America Mexicana Again' Hat -- Image Was Made Using X's AI Tool
articles.summary: Claudia Sheinbaum, the president of Mexico, was photographed wearing a "Make America Mexicana Again" hat. The embassy of Mexico said the image is not real. The logo of Grok, X's AI tool, had been doctored out of the original image. There is no evidence that the face in the photo is Claudia.

articles.title: Report finds that 40% of small business owners are using AI tools for help
articles.author: Kathryn Pinkston
articles.summary: 40% of small businesses in the U.S. are now using AI tools to work smarter and not harder. Google is featuring small business owners in all 50 states in their Super Bowl ad campaign. AI is a time-saving tool for small businesses and helps them focus on what matters.

articles.title: 10 signs AI is here to Stay
articles.author: info@firebrandmediainc.com
articles.summary: There are 10 signs that AI is here to stay. People are buying AI companions for emotional support, therapeutic benefits, and to have a virtual friend available 24/7. Businesses are relying on AI to keep their workforces running efficiently. Government agencies are investing in AI technology for the general public and for national security. Private companies are using AI technology in space exploration.

articles.title: CSU leaning into AI with first dedicated platform for students
articles.author: Monterey Herald
articles.summary: The California State University will establish the nation's first and largest artificial intelligence-powered platform for students, staff and faculty. The initiative surpasses any existing university model in both scale and impact. It positions the CSU as a global leader in the impactful, responsible and equitable adoption of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Is AI making men socially awkward?
articles.author: Jack Bankhead
articles.summary: AI is changing the way we work and engage with others. Some people argue that AI is helping men become more communicative with their partners, while others express concerns that it's impacting their social skills. We have seen a shift from real life chats to digital communication in the last few years. More and more men are choosing to connect with chatbot-inspired relationships over real-life ones. Men need to be of certain personality type to excel in various job settings.

articles.title: Google erases promise not to use AI technology for weapons or surveillance
articles.author: Ramishah Maruf
articles.summary: Google's updated AI ethics policy removes its promise that it won't use the technology to pursue applications for weapons and surveillance. Google first published its AI Principles in 2018, years before the technology became almost ubiquitous. In 2018, Google dropped a $10 billion bid for a cloud computing Pentagon contract.

articles.title: AI-Generated Slop Is Already In Your Public Library
articles.author: Slashdot
articles.summary: AI-generated books are being uploaded to public libraries via their digital catalogs. This makes it difficult for understaffed librarians to sort through the content. 404 Media and others have come to call AI-generated content "AI slop" as a result.

articles.title: Google has ‘very good ideas' for native ads in Gemini
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: Google's Gemini AI assistant doesn't have ads today, but the company has'very good ideas' for ways they could show up down the road. Right now, you can access Gemini for free or pay for a subscription to use advanced features, but it sounds like ads could be part of the product at some point.

articles.title: AMD Tumbles After Giving Disappointing Outlook for AI Growth
articles.author: Ian King
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices shares fell 8% in late trading after giving disappointing outlook for its data center business. The division will grow by a percentage in the'strong' double digits this year, but it's struggling to catch up with AI computing leader Nvidia Corp. The report renewed concern that AMD's push into AI equipment has lost some momentum.

articles.title: Modern Tools for Business Transformation: How Cybergarden's AI and Automation Solutions Empower Melbourne's Small Businesses to Catch Up with the Digital Revolution
articles.author: Cyber Garden
articles.summary: Melbourne-based digital innovation company Cybergarden is revolutionizing how businesses in Melbourne leverage artificial intelligence, automation, and modern web technologies to enhance efficiency, engagement, and profitability. The company offers 24/7 AI chatbot solutions that handle customer inquiries seamlessly and intelligent voice AI that eliminates hold times and improves call efficiency.

articles.title: Nurses at BayCare's St. Anthony's Hospital pilot AI technology to help with care
articles.author: Erin Murray
articles.summary: Nurses at St. Anthony's Hospital in St. Petersburg have been using artificial intelligence for over a month to help streamline and increase one-on-one patient care. It is a pilot program. BayCare has already begun using AI-assisted software for physicians in their offices.

articles.title: Palantir seems to be winning the AI arms race with huge growth
articles.author: The Times/The Sunday Times
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies is promising to make artificial intelligence technology useful to large institutions. The company is only 22 years old. Palantir is based in the U.S. and sells data-mining software to institutions. It is valued at $22 billion.

articles.title: CSU leaning into AI with first dedicated platform for students
articles.author: Andrea Valadez
articles.summary: The AI platform will include research, professional development and teaching tools. It will be available to the CSU community at no cost and will include the AI platform, research and development tools for CSU students and faculty members. It is expected to be available within a few years.

articles.title: Understanding: The Fallacy of Laziness in Technological Advancement
articles.author: Mike Zimmer
articles.summary: Some people label AI-assisted work as lazy because it reduces human effort. The primary function of technology has always been to reduce labor and increase productivity. The argument that AI use is lazy collapses when we recognize that effort alone does not determine value, but quality of the final product does.

articles.title: OpenAI rebrands itself
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: OpenAI has just given itself a full rebrand with a new logo, typeface, and color palette. The original logo was designed by CEO Sam Altman and co-founder Ilya Sutskever, but the new design was created by an in-house team led by Veit Moeller and Shannon Jager.

articles.title: Here's OpenAI's new logo
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: OpenAI just gave itself a full rebrand with a new logo, typeface, and color palette. The original logo was designed by the company's co-founders Greg Brockman and Ilya Sutskever, but the new design was created by an in-house team led by Veit Moeller and Shannon Jager.

articles.title: Head of US AI Safety Institute to Leave as Trump Shifts Course
articles.author: Shirin Ghaffary
articles.summary: Elizabeth Kelly, the director of the US AI Safety Institute, is stepping down at the end of the week. She is leaving a key government group focused on artificial intelligence under the Trump administration. Her departure comes as world leaders and tech executives head to Paris for an AI summit. Vice President JD Vance will attend the event.

articles.title: AMD's AI Revenue Jumps, But Misses Estimates
articles.author: Connor Hart
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices posted higher quarterly revenue thanks to significant growth in its data-center business. Shares fell 3.8%, to $114.91, after the bell. The stock is down 29% in the past year, as some analysts and investors have found the AI positioning of AMD's competitors more compelling.

articles.title: Is Google's Genie 2 AI model the evolution of procedurally generated games?
articles.author: Benjamin Zeman
articles.summary: Genie 2 is an AI-powered game-generating tool developed by Google DeepMind. It analyzes on-screen elements and generates gameplay content as players navigate 3D environments. It uses advanced machine learning to create complete playable worlds in real time. There's no announced launch date, but you can play with Genie 2 online soon.

articles.title: You Expect Me To Believe That?!? (Ft. Tim Robinson)
articles.summary: Daily Fail is still writing articles about stuff they fed into AI. Daily Fail is writing about an ultra-realistic AI depiction of Los Angeles affected by climate change.Enable JavaScript for Fark in order to vote for entries. Log in to the page to enable voting.

articles.title: OmniHuman: ByteDance's new AI creates realistic videos from a single photo
articles.author: Venture Beat
articles.summary: ByteDance's new OmniHuman AI can turn a photo into a realistic video of a person speaking, singing and moving naturally. It was trained on 18,700 hours of human motion data and can turn any picture into a video of the same subject.

articles.title: York College professor receives $10,000 grant for ‘multispectral AI crop analysis'
articles.author: Hayden Sherry
articles.summary: Stephen Wilkerson won a $10,000 grant as part of $10 million in Agricultural Innovation grants. He visited big wine growers in California to observe how they use AI and drones to create maps to improve crop yields. The grant aims to assist AI for smaller farms in York County.

articles.title: Marvel Denies Using AI in ‘Fantastic Four' Poster
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Marvel Studios did not use artificial intelligence in the creation of its latest poster for 'Fantastic Four: First Steps'. The studio is committed to involving skilled artists and designers in its promotional materials. The use of AI in creative fields has become a topic of intense debate, with concerns raised about its potential impact on human jobs and artistic integrity. Anya Petrova, Head of Visual Development at Marvel Studios, believes AI can be incredibly powerful in the development of the visual assets.

articles.title: Cloudflare Adopts Content Credentials for Image Authenticity
articles.author: Megan Crouse
articles.summary: Cloudflare has integrated Content Credentials metadata into Cloudflare Images. The standard was proposed in 2021 by the Coalition for Content Provenance and Authenticity (C2PA). It's used by 20% of internet properties. Google and Adobe adopted it last year and Google Search signed on in September 2024.

articles.title: Porterhouse revenues hit after brewery sale
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is rapidly changing the world. It has the potential to revolutionize industries, reshape economies, and influence social structures. It is essential to address potential inequalities and promote responsible development and deployment. Collaboration between governments, industry, and academia is vital to promote inclusivity and address the potential societal impacts of AI.

articles.title: Adobe releases generative AI contract management tool
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Adobe has integrated AI-powered summarization capabilities into its Acrobat Document Cloud platform through the Acrobat AI Assistant. The AI technology empowers users to analyze and understand complex legal agreements embedded in PDF documents with unprecedented efficiency. Acrobat's AI integration extends beyond contract review, paving the way for broader automation within document workflows.

articles.title: After DeepSeek Release, Senator Introduces Bill to Decouple US, Chinese AI
articles.author: The Epoch Times
articles.summary: The United States is considering new legislation to protect American artificial intelligence development and prevent it from advancing communist China's AI capabilities. Sen. Josh Hawley (R-Mo.) launched the 'Decoupling America's Artificial Intelligence Capabilities from China Act'.

articles.title: Tech advances to lower AI costs: IBM chairman Arvind Krishna
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: IBM chairman and CEO Arvind Krishna believes that AI systems do not need to consume a lot of resources or require substantial investments to be effective. He believes the AI race is focused on whether bigger models mean better outcomes, but not on whether they need to be expensive.

articles.title: AMD Data Center Sales Miss Estimates in Sign of AI Slowdown
articles.author: Ian King
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. reported disappointing results for its data center division. Shares of the chipmaker slid 5% in late trading after the report was released. AMD is trying to persuade some of the biggest companies to include its AI products in their data center expansion plans. It's still playing catch-up with Nvidia in this endeavor.

articles.title: Scientists Design Self-Healing Asphalt that Can Mend its Own Cracks
articles.author: Greek Reporter
articles.summary: A team of scientists from Swansea University, King's College London and Chile are working on self-healing asphalt roads designed with AI and made from biomass waste. They have brought together experts in civil engineering, chemistry, and computer science, combining this knowledge with the state-of-the-art AI tools of Google Cloud.

articles.title: Can this tech billionaire save the media from an AI apocalypse?
articles.author: Alyson Shontell
articles.summary: Matthew Prince is the cofounder of Cloudflare, a cybersecurity company. He is concerned about the decline of the content industry due to the rise of AI. He wants to charge content creators to use AI to generate revenue. Prince bought his local paper, the Park Record, which he is trying to turn into a nonprofit.

articles.title: ChatGPT in Shambles
articles.author: Gary Marcus
articles.summary: ChatGPT failed to count to 50 all U.S. states. It couldn't count vowels. Sayash Kapoor, co-author of AI snake oil, reported some tests of OpenAI's new Operator agent this morning, pushing the boundaries of intelligence by writing expense reports.

articles.title: State universities launch 'landmark' AI quest for students and profs
articles.author: George Avalos
articles.summary: The California State University system has teamed up with several tech titans to create an AI-powered higher education system. San Jose State University and CSU East Bay in Hayward would be among the California state universities whose students and teachers could benefit from the artificial intelligence push. AI tools and training will be available to 460,000 students and 63,000 faculty and staff.

articles.title: California universities launch ‘landmark' AI quest for students and profs
articles.author: George Avalos
articles.summary: The California State University system has teamed up with several tech titans to create an AI-powered higher education system. Adobe, Google owner Alphabet, Nvidia, LinkedIn, Intel, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft, IBM, OpenAI and Instructure are the tech companies that are working with the state universities to power the initiative. CSU hopes the effort will help it to develop an AI workforce for California.

articles.title: State universities launch 'landmark' AI quest for students and profs
articles.author: George Avalos
articles.summary: The California State University system has teamed up with several tech titans to launch a "landmark" AI quest. The project will be led by AI expert Professor Fei-Fei Huang of Cal State University Los Angeles. He will be the chief scientist for the project.

articles.title: Fact Check: Image Of ICE Agent Restraining Crying Girl Is NOT Authentic -- AI Generated
articles.summary: The image of an agent from Immigration and Customs Enforcement restraining a distressed little girl is AI generated. It was posted on X on January 24, 2025 by the account @LiveOnTheChat. Snopes found out that he used the xAI chatbot tool Grok to generate the image.

articles.title: AI will not push mankind into extinction but it may harm ill-prepared countries, experts warn
articles.author: Euronews
articles.summary: DeepSeek, a Chinese AI chatbot, was unveiled at Kazakhstan's seventh annual Almaty Digital Forum. It cost $6 million (€5.8 million) to make, but it's incomparably cheaper than other AI chatbots. Kazakhstan will launch an initiative - and a dedicated centre - called Alemai to become a hub for AI research, start-ups, and international collaboration. Kazakhstan's Minister of Digital Development, Innovation, and Aerospace Industry announced that in 2030, the country will have trained no less than a million people in AI.

articles.title: Will AI Revolutionize Drug Development? These Are the Root Causes of Drug Failure It Must Address
articles.author: Christian Macedonia
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is being used to design drugs and optimize clinical trials. The current drug development process operates like a checkbox approach. It takes 10 to 15 years and $1 billion to $2 billion to bring one drug to market. AI-generated drugs have yet to address the 90% failure rate of new drugs in clinical trials, so its effect on drug development remains unclear.

articles.title: 'Pride of His Hometown': Who Is DeepSeek Founder Liang Wenfeng? What to Know About the 40-Year Old Billionaire
articles.author: Sherin Shibu
articles.summary: Liang Wenfeng, 40, is the founder of the AI startup DeepSeek. He returned to Guangdong for Lunar New Year's Eve celebrations last week. The village honored him with a red banner that said, "Warm congratulations for becoming the pride of his hometown."

articles.title: Raymond James Upgrades Booz Allen Hamilton Holding (BAH) to ‘Outperform' with $150 Target
articles.author: Niloy Chakrabarti
articles.summary: Booz Allen Hamilton Holding Corporation (NYSE:BAH) ranks 6th on Insider Monkey's list of the trending AI stocks. Raymond James upgraded BAH to 'Outperform' from 'Market Perform' with a $150 price target per share. BAH offers technology consulting, analysis, and engineering services around AI, cybersecurity, cloud computing, mission operations, and digital transformation.

articles.title: How AI is disrupting the fashion industry
articles.author: Julia Boorstin
articles.summary: CNBC's Julia Boorstin reports on how AI is disrupting the fashion industry and how it can be used to improve fashion design in the future. She talks about AI and fashion design on CNBC's "This is Life with Julia Boraostin".

articles.title: Meet your AI match: The rise of AI dating
articles.author: Julia Boorstin
articles.summary: CNBC's Julia Boorstin reports on how AI is disrupting the dating industry and how it's changing the dating scene.   iReport.com will let you know if you want to get in touch with Julia. iReport is happy to help.

articles.title: New Southington HS Classes Pitched In AI And Video-Game Design
articles.author: Michael Lemanski
articles.summary: Southington Board of Education is mulling creation of an artificial intelligence class and a video-game design course at SHS. The AI course would be an elective for students in grades 10-12 and would teach "programming concepts that enable the use of artificial intelligence in computer science and society at large." The video game course would help students develop logical thinking and problem-solving skills needed to program and create video games.

articles.title: Aitomatic's DXA Factory Platform to Power Next Billion AI Agents Through Global System Integrator Partnerships
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: ITOCHU Techno-Solutions Corporation and FPT have selected Aitomatic's first-to-market DXA Factory platform for worldwide deployment. ItoCHU will focus on developing and deploying Domain-Expert Agents for the financial services industry. FPT's AI Center will advance industrial AI applications for semiconductor clients.

articles.title: Is Klarna's Vaunted AI Job Elimination Claim Really Pre-IPO Marketing?
articles.author: Bruce Crumley
articles.summary: Sebastian Siemiatkowski's fintech company, Klarna, has replaced employees with artificial intelligence apps. The company's headcount dropped from 4,500 to 3,500 in a year and it stopped hiring about a year ago. Klarna's first AI assistant performed the work of 700 customer service agents in its first month and saved over $12 million in marketing, sales, and even legal costs.

articles.title: AI company Anthropic's ironic warning to job candidates: ‘Please do not use AI'
articles.author: Emma Burleigh
articles.summary: Anthropic has an 'AI policy' for job candidates that discourages them from using AI during the application process. The company wants to evaluate candidates' human communication skills. Anthropic is one of the world's leading AI companies and touts the benefits of AI technology.

articles.title: OpenAI targets higher education in the US with ChatGPT rollout at California State University
articles.author: Khaleejtimes
articles.summary: Microsoft-backed OpenAI will roll out an education-specific version of its chatbot to 500,000 students and faculty at California State University as it looks to expand its user base in the academic sector and expand the reach of the chatbot's technology.

articles.title: Snapchat is jumping on the AI image generation bandwagon
articles.author: Taylor Kerns
articles.summary: Snapchat is developing an in-house AI image generation model. The AI model can produce high-resolution images in under 1.5 seconds depending on your device. Snap plans to implement the AI model in Snapchat features later this year. It will power AI Snaps, AI Bitmoji Backgrounds, and more.

articles.title: Krutrim Launches India's First Frontier Research AI Lab to Democratise AI Innovation; Commits Investment of $1.2 Billion by Next Year
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Krutrim, India's first AI unicorn, announced the launch of Krutrim AI Lab. The lab aims to create state-of-the-art AI infrastructure and build cutting-edge AI models tailored for Indic languages and real-world applications.

articles.title: QCI Heatmap: A Modern Evolution of Classic Data Visualization with Cutting-Edge Technology
articles.author: Qci
articles.summary: QCI has launched QCI Heatmap, an advanced contour heatmapping tool that transforms the way casinos interact with slot performance data. This release represents a unique modernization of classic data visualization techniques, reimagined using state-of-the-art graphics processing and machine learning.

articles.title: Salesforce Reportedly Cuts 1,000 Jobs While Adding AI Salespeople
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Salesforce Reportedly Cuts 1,000 Jobs While Adding AI Salespeople PYMNTS at Salesforce.com. Salesforce is adding AI salespeople to replace the current human salespeople.   Salesforce will hire more AI salesperson.

articles.title: Adobe Acrobat AI now reads and explains your contracts in minutes — here's how it works
articles.summary: Adobe announced a new AI-powered contract analysis tool today. The technology works by analyzing contract text and presenting information in digestible formats. According to Adobe's research, nearly 70% of consumers have signed contracts without understanding all the terms. 64% of small business owners have avoided signing contracts due to uncertainty about the content.

articles.title: CSU Launches Landmark AI Initiative to Become Nation's Largest AI-Powered University System
articles.author: Matt Wreden
articles.summary: The California State University system is embarking on a groundbreaking public-private initiative that will make it the nation's first and largest AI-powered university system. CSU is partnering with leading tech companies such as Adobe, Alphabet (Google), AWS, IBM, Instructure, Intel, LinkedIn, Microsoft, NVIDIA, and the Office of Governor Gavin Newsom. The initiative aims to provide more than 460,000 students and 63,000 faculty and staff across all 23 CSU campuses with equitable access to advanced AI tools and technologies.

articles.title: ChatGPT's AI agents are here, and this is how I want to use them
articles.author: BGR
articles.summary: It's morning. ChatGPT is looking for the latest deals on the running shoes that he's been wanting to buy. He's about to go to the bakery around the corner before he goes to work. He'll buy them at the bakery's bakery shop.

articles.title: ChatGPT's AI agents are here, and this is how I want to use them
articles.summary: ChatGPT launched Operator and Deep Research AI agents. ChatGPT Plus users in the EU have access to Operator, but not to Deep Research. The AI agents will help us get things done faster and free up time for other activities. Chat GPT will be able to pass instructions between AI agents in the future.

articles.title: Ark Invest's Cathie Wood: AI's Biggest Opportunity Is Healthcare
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: The convergence of artificial intelligence (AI) and healthcare is transforming the industry. Cathie Wood, CEO and founder of Ark invest, believes this intersection presents vast untapped opportunities, particularly in the realm of personalized medicine. AI-powered platforms are empowering researchers to analyze massive datasets and identify potential drug candidates at an unprecedented pace. Palantir's foundry platform provides healthcare organizations with tools to integrate and analyze vast amounts of patient data. Early adopters and investors are already reaping the benefits.

articles.title: OpenAI targets higher education in the U.S. with ChatGPT rollout at California State University
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Microsoft-backed OpenAI will roll out an education-specific version of its chatbot to about 500,000 students and faculty at California State University. The rollout will cover 23 campuses of the largest public university system in the United States. OpenAI has been looking to integrate ChatGPT into classrooms since 2023.

articles.title: Putting DeepSeek to the test: how its performance compares against other AI tools
articles.author: Simon Thorne
articles.summary: China's new AI chatbot, DeepSeek, has disrupted the US-dominated market. It uses cheaper Nvidia H800 chips over the more expensive state-of-the-art versions. However, the company has faced criticism over its responses to politically sensitive topics in China.

articles.title: Half A Million Students Given ChatGPT As CSU Makes AI History
articles.author: Dan Fitzpatrick
articles.summary: Half a million students at California State University (CSU) will get ChatGPT Edu, an education-focused version of OpenAI's chatbot. The CSU system serves nearly 500,000 students across 23 campuses. CSU-OpenAI partnership could serve as a model for how universities can integrate emerging technologies effectively.

articles.title: CSU unveils massive venture to provide free AI skills and training across all 23 campuses
articles.author: Teresa Watanabe
articles.summary: California State University has launched an initiative to provide AI tools and training in the groundbreaking technology across the system's 23 campuses. Nearly half of CSU's 450,000 students are low-income and about 30% are the first in their families to attend college. CSU has developed a systemwide "AI Commons Hub" that provides free access to tools such as ChatGPT 4.0. Industry partners will provide internships and apprenticeships to give students real-world experience with AI on the job.

articles.title: WhatsApp's ChatGPT Is Getting an Upgrade
articles.author: Arol Wright
articles.summary: ChatGPT is available to any WhatsApp user by texting 1-800-CHATGPT. Now, the WhatsApp version of ChatGPT accepts image inputs in addition to text. It can also send voice messages and respond in text format within the WhatsApp chat. OpenAI is also adding account linking for chatbot users on WhatsApp, effective tomorrow.

articles.title: Elon Musk's Grok AI chatbot app to become available for Android users soon
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Elon Musk-owned artificial intelligence startup xAI's chatbot, Grok, will soon be available for Android as a standalone app. The app is now open for testing in Australia, Canada, India, Philippines, and Saudi Arabia and is listed on the Google Play Store.

articles.title: QCI Heatmap: A Modern Evolution of Classic Data Visualization with Cutting-Edge Technology
articles.author: QCI
articles.summary: QCI is revolutionizing data exploration and visualization with the launch of QCI Heatmap, an advanced contour heatmapping tool that transforms the way casinos interact with slot performance data. This release represents a unique modernization of classic data visualization techniques, reimagined using state-of-the-art graphics processing and machine learning.

articles.title: QCI Heatmap: A Modern Evolution of Classic Data Visualization with Cutting-Edge Technology
articles.author: QCI
articles.summary: QCI has launched QCI Heatmap, an advanced contour heatmapping tool that transforms the way casinos interact with slot performance data. The tool provides full Gaming Floor Visibility, interactive overlays of slot performance, customer behavior, and revenue patterns. QCI is retiring the legacy QCI Slots View module and elevating data visualization to the next level. The impact of the tool is already being felt across the industry.

articles.title: C-suite AI Choices: Artificial Intelligence Or Artificial Stupidity
articles.author: Dean De Biase
articles.summary: The global beauty industry is booming. Statista estimates the market will grow to $768B by 2029. Dermalogica, a professional-grade skin-care company acquired by Unilever, trains 100,000 skin therapists annually in advanced tech and is a good case study on how to make CX better.

articles.title: Sam Altman of OpenAI partners with South Korea's Kakao after DeepSeek scare
articles.author: Vishnu Kaimal
articles.summary: Kakao will use ChatGPT for its new artificial intelligence services. Kakao owns an online bank, South Korea's largest taxi-hailing app and messaging app KakaoTalk. Sam Altman is one of the co-founders of OpenAI. OpenAI is a research organization focused on creating and promoting friendly artificial intelligence.

articles.title: February Tech Fest
articles.author: Dominique Young
articles.summary: Dive into the world of smart tech in our AI class. Train machines to think, solve problems and surprise you with what they can do. Free February Tech Fest offers games development, AI, robotics, and Python in a fun, hands-on environment.

articles.title: Optimal Blue Announces Ask Obi, an AI Assistant to Provide Mortgage Lending Executives With Real-Time Business Insights
articles.author: Optimal Blue
articles.summary: Ask Obi is an AI assistant designed to provide mortgage lending executives with instant, actionable insights from their Optimal Blue products and data. Ask Obi was unveiled at the inaugural Summit user conference in San Diego. It gives lenders the power to view their operations holistically with data aggregation across their comprehensive capital markets platform.

articles.title: Optimal Blue Announces Ask Obi, an AI Assistant to Provide Mortgage Lending Executives With Real-Time Business Insights
articles.author: Send2Press
articles.summary: -Conversational generative AI chat assistant to provide easy-to-understand, interactive insights and graphical representations to help lenders maximize profitability.   .   "Lenders Maximize Profits" by using AI chat assistants, according to the company.

articles.title: AI wrote this headline (and created this image): 'The Machines Are Learning, and It's Getting Spooky'
articles.author: Neil Steinberg
articles.summary: A year ago, Google's Gemini AI wrote a column in the style of Neil Steinberg of the Chicago Sun-Times. In the past year, AI has improved a lot. AI can write essays, poems, and even screenplays. It can compose original music. AI art generators spit out realistic images. Jobs that were once considered safe are now facing an uncertain future.

articles.title: How firefighters are leveraging artificial intelligence technology to detect wildfires faster than humans
articles.author: Gavin Nguyen
articles.summary: CAL FIRE personnel are using artificial intelligence to detect wildfires. The technology was developed using the Alert California wildfire cameras. It has been deployed across all 21 CAL FIRE dispatch centers across the state, including here in Southern California. Last year, a wildfire in Orange County was detected exclusively using this technology.

articles.title: Wix.Com Ltd. (WIX) Launches AI-Driven Business Launcher to Help Entrepreneurs Bring Ideas to Life
articles.author: Abdul Rahman
articles.summary: Wix.com Ltd. (NASDAQ:WIX) is a cloud-based web development platform provider. WIX ranks 6th on Insider Monkey's list of the AI stocks that are making headlines right now. According to a PwC analysis, AI could contribute up to $15.7 trillion to the global economy in 2030.

articles.title: Fuel Cycle Unveils AI-Powered Tags, Transforming Qualitative Research with Autonomous Insights
articles.author: FUEL CYCLE
articles.summary: Fuel Cycle has unveiled AI-powered tags. The technology will revolutionize how unstructured data is cleaned, labeled, and analyzed. It will also reduce processing time from days to minutes, unlocking a new era of autonomous research. It is reshaping the way businesses understand their customers.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence Is Here: How The Innovative Technology Is Taking Over The Stateline
articles.author: Manny Estopinan
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence is being used in many different industries and job sectors. Richtech Robotics is developing collaborative robots that can work with humans. Rockford Public Schools is piloting the Magic School program to prepare students and teachers for a modern workforce. Some fear AI could be a threat to creativity or problem solving.

articles.title: Former UWM associate vice chancellor Phyllis King named chief strategist for AI advancement at WCTC
articles.author: Samantha Dietel
articles.summary: Phyllis King will become WCTC's chief strategist for artificial intelligence advancement later this month. She will 'lead the growth and development of the AI advancement' at the college. She is a former associate vice chancellor at the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee.

articles.title: Hackers are using AI to attack your Mac and it's only going to get worse

In the aftermath, scientists called for better forecasting models to accurately predict solar flares and their impact on the Earth. Now, researchers at the University of Genova in Italy claim to have developed an AI model that can track and analyse the evolution of Sun's active regions and predict the occurrence of solar flares.
